âœ¨ bubbles | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Adding a screensaver effect to websites after a period of inactivity.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Drop-in screensaver script for websites â€¢ Configurable delay, speed, interval, minsize, and maxsize parameters
ðŸ“– Summary: The 'bubbles' repository provides a simple, drop-in screensaver script for websites. It displays floating bubbles when a page is idle, offering a visually engaging way to prevent screen burn-in or simply add a touch of whimsy. The script is configurable with parameters to adjust the delay, speed, size, and frequency of the bubbles.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ jmp | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Quickly access websites and perform searches using custom shortcuts.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Local DuckDuckGo bangs â€¢ Golinks â€¢ Simple axum based web server â€¢ Configuration via TOML file
ðŸ“– Summary: The jmp repository provides a local, lightweight alternative to browser extensions for creating custom search shortcuts (DuckDuckGo bangs and golinks). It uses an axum-based web server and TOML configuration to allow users to define shortcuts for quickly accessing websites and performing searches.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ ecode | Lua
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Lightweight, multi-platform code editing with a focus on responsiveness and performance.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Lightweight and portable â€¢ Syntax highlighting with LSP support â€¢ Multi-cursor support â€¢ LSP and DAP support â€¢ Git integration
ðŸ“– Summary: Ecode is a lightweight, multi-platform code editor designed for modern hardware, emphasizing responsiveness and performance. Built on the eepp GUI framework, it offers features like syntax highlighting, multi-cursor support, LSP and DAP integration, Git and terminal support, and customizable settings, making it suitable for developers seeking a fast and efficient coding environment.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ wrapguard | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Transparently route application network traffic through a WireGuard VPN without requiring container privileges or kernel modules.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Pure Userspace operation (no kernel modules or special privileges) â€¢ Transparent network call interception using LD_PRELOAD â€¢ Bidirectional connection support (incoming and outgoing) â€¢ Standard WireGuard configuration file compatibility
ðŸ“– Summary: WrapGuard is a userspace WireGuard proxy that allows applications to transparently tunnel all network traffic through a WireGuard VPN. It operates without requiring container privileges or kernel modules by intercepting network calls using LD_PRELOAD. It supports both incoming and outgoing connections and uses standard WireGuard configuration files.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ daedalOS | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a fully functional desktop environment within a web browser.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ File System with drag and drop support and archive extraction â€¢ Resizable and draggable windows with animation â€¢ Start Menu with expandable sidebar and spotlight effect â€¢ Taskbar with peek hover preview and AI Chat Agent â€¢ Clock with NTP server time mode and calendar popup
ðŸ“– Summary: daedalOS is a JavaScript-based project that emulates a desktop environment within a web browser. It offers features such as a file system with drag-and-drop support, resizable windows, a start menu, a taskbar, and customizable backgrounds, enabling users to perform typical desktop tasks directly in their browser.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ helium | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Web automation using Python with a focus on simplicity and readability.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ High-level API for web automation â€¢ Simplified iFrame interaction â€¢ Automatic window management â€¢ Implicit and explicit waits â€¢ Mixable with Selenium
ðŸ“– Summary: Helium is a Python library that simplifies web automation by providing a high-level API on top of Selenium. It allows developers to interact with web elements using user-visible labels instead of complex selectors, resulting in shorter, more readable, and more stable scripts. Helium also simplifies common tasks like iFrame interaction and window management.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ webscrapbook | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Capturing and archiving web pages for future access and manipulation.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Web page capture â€¢ Archive formats â€¢ Customizable configurations â€¢ Future retrieval â€¢ Organization
ðŸ“– Summary: WebScrapBook is a browser extension designed to capture web pages faithfully in various archive formats. It allows users to retrieve, organize, annotate, and edit captured web content locally or on a backend server. The project is a successor to the ScrapBook X Firefox add-on.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
